posts.name: Elijah Beard
posts.cooked:
We are attempting to use PathPlanner to follow a path. We can drive the robot around fine but when we follow an auto path it seems to be inversed. Things we have tried:

We tried changing the holonomic heading

We tried setting the zero yaw to 180 (we are using team 364 BaseFalconSwerve as a drive base)

we have tried physically flipping the pigeon 2 gyro around

The robot drives fine so I do not think our actual kinematics are the problem but I am open to suggestions!

posts.name: Fletch
posts.cooked: When you built the path, did you build it on the red side or the blue side? When trying to follow the path, is the driver station set to a red alliance or blue alliance position?

posts.name: Elijah Beard
posts.cooked: I built the path on the blue side and I made sure the Alliance Station was set to Blue. I am going to try building it on the red side to see if it magically works.

posts.name: Fletch
posts.cooked: Thats the problem then.  Pathplanner will automatically invert paths for the blue alliance.  Make sure you’re always building paths from the red alliance side and everything will just work
PathPlanner inverts paths for the red alliance. Paths should always be built on the blue side of the field.

posts.name: Fletch
posts.cooked: Wait, did i have thar backwards…? I knew the logic was right, but now you have me second-guessing myself.
Yeah you had it backwards lol. I think the next step is to see a video both of the robot and the field (maybe separate videos) to determine what “inversed” actually means.

posts.name: Elijah Beard
posts.cooked: Well, I was digging around the PathPlanner code, and I found out that the loadPath function from PathFinder lets you add a reversed boolean value. So I did that, and now the robot follows the path but in a 90 degree offset. Our code can be found here in case the way I built the swerve auto command is the issue (though tele-op works fine). It is not the most up-to-date though as my experimentations have not been pushed.

posts.name: system
posts.cooked: This topic was automatically closed 365 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
